data.title: Bratt Name Meaning, Family History, Family Crest & Coats of Arms
data.meta_description: Read the Bratt surname history and see the family crest, coat of arms for the German Origin. Discover the Bratt surname history. Where did the name Bratt come from?
data.text:
Bratt History, Family Crest & Coats of Arms

Origins Available:

England

Germany

Loading...

Early Origins of the Bratt family

The surname Bratt was first found in Prussia, where the name emerged in medieval times as one of the notable families of the region. From the 13th century the surname was identified with the great social and economic evolution which made this territory a landmark contributor to the development of the nation.

Loading...

Early History of the Bratt family

This web page shows only a small excerpt of our Bratt research. Another 109 words (8 lines of text) covering the year 1798 is included under the topic Early Bratt History in all our PDF Extended History products and printed products wherever possible.

Loading...

Bratt Spelling Variations

Spelling variations of this family name include: Braatz, Braats, Brats, Bratz, Bratsche, Bratt and many more.

Loading...

Early Notables of the Bratt family

More information is included under the topic Early Bratt Notables in all our PDF Extended History products and printed products wherever possible.

Bratt Ranking

In the United States, the name Bratt is the 17,430th most popular surname with an estimated 2,487 people with that name. 1

Loading...

Bratt migration to the United States +

Some of the first settlers of this family name were:

Bratt Settlers in United States in the 17th Century

Albert Andriese Bratt, who arrived in New Netherland(s) in 1620-1664 2

Albert Andriessen Bratt, who settled in New York in 1636

Albert Andriesse DeNoorman Bratt, who landed in New York in 1637 2

Arent Andriesse Bratt, who arrived in New York in 1637 2

Eva Albertse Bratt, who landed in New York in 1637 2

... (More are available in all our PDF Extended History products and printed products wherever possible.)

Bratt Settlers in United States in the 19th Century

Arthur Bratt, who arrived in Baltimore in 1830

William Bratt, who landed in Allegany (Allegheny) County, Pennsylvania in 1831 2

Moses Bratt, who landed in Allegany (Allegheny) County, Pennsylvania in 1832 2

Edward Bratt, who arrived in Allegany (Allegheny) County, Pennsylvania in 1838 2

Eric Georg Bratt, aged 33, who arrived in Boston, Massachusetts in 1848 2

... (More are available in all our PDF Extended History products and printed products wherever possible.)

Bratt migration to Australia +

Emigration to Australia followed the First Fleets of convicts, tradespeople and early settlers. Early immigrants include:

Bratt Settlers in Australia in the 19th Century

Mr. Samuel Bratt, British Convict who was convicted in Middlesex, England for 7 years, transported aboard the "Asia" on 5th November 1835, arriving in Tasmania (Van Diemen's Land)1836 3

Mr. Thomas Bratt, English convict who was convicted in Stafford, Staffordshire, England for 7 years, transported aboard the "Barossa" on 9th May 1844, arriving in Tasmania (Van Diemen's Land) 4

Mr. John Bratt, (b. 1819), aged 27, English farm labourer who was convicted in Warwick, Warwickshire, England for 15 years for burglary, transported aboard the "China" on 33rd January 1846, arriving in Norfolk Island, Australia, he died in 1877 5

Contemporary Notables of the name Bratt (post 1700) +

Ruth Bratt, English actress and comedian who has made appearances on several TV shows including FAQ U on Channel 4 (2005) and Rob Brydon's Annually Retentive on BBC Three (2006)

Benjamin Bratt (b. 1963), American actor and producer, known for his work in Demolition Man (1993), Clear and Present Danger (1994), and The River Wild (1994) and from 1995 to 1999, he starred as New York City Police Department (NYPD) Detective Rey Curtis on the NBC drama series Law & Order; he has received four ALMA Awards, a Primetime Emmy Award nomination, and a Blockbuster Entertainment Award

Historic Events for the Bratt family +

HMS Prince of Wales

Mr. Harold W Bratt, British Stoker 1st Class, who sailed into battle on the HMS Prince of Wales (1941) and survived the sinking 6
